WorkItem.Description:
Processing this through the Evaluator tool in Excel, the 0 value is the correct return for Excel when a cell is blank, but the referenced worksheet still exists: if the referenced worksheet doesn't exist, then Excel will return a #REF! error. By default, this will be displayed as a 0. So the result for a formula of =IV65535 will display as 0 in Excel if IV65535 isn't populated. Likewise, if sheet2 exists, then the formula =Sheet2!IV65535 will return a 0; but =Sheet999!IV65535 will return a #REF! error (assuming Sheet999 does not exist)
Â 
The behaviour of PHPExcel isn't strictly correct here. If the referenced cell is in the current worksheet, then PHPExcel correctly returns a NULL; but it always returns a #REF! error if the cell reference is in another worksheet, but doesn't exist, even if the referenced worksheet itself is valid. This behaviour needs modifying to return a NULL if the worksheet exists, and only to return a #REF! error if the referenced worksheet doesn't exist
WorkItem.Summary: problem with getting cell values from another worksheet...

Comments.Message:
Hi MarkBaker,

Thanks for the reply! I understand what you have explained to the problem i have posted. But the question is:
let us say the $worksheetname="worksheet1" and there are two worksheets in a Workbook. so the second worksheet (worksheet2) have some reference cell from "worksheet1". 

So on the worksheet2,

this code: $objPHPExcel->getActiveSheet()->setCellValue('D'.$cns, "='$worksheetname'!I".$cns); works perfectly. thought it returns 0 when the referenced cell is NULL.

The problem here is 
when i try to add a IF statement to the formula to validate the cell, IF the reference cell is NULL, THEN return Empty.
Then the code become:

$objPHPExcel->getActiveSheet()->setCellValue('C'.$cns, "=IF('$worksheetname'!D".$cns.")="","", '$worksheetname'!D".$cns);

since the excel file need to be saved, so on the end of the php file, the following statement has been used:
 $objWriter = PHPExcel_IOFactory::createWriter($objPHPExcel, 'Excel5');
$objWriter->save('php://output'); 

what the output from the web browser shows that the webpage is not found. It simple does not create the excel file at all.

Is it because of the double quote("") or single quote('') in the formula that gives the problem?

For your reference, PHPExcel version : 1.7.2
Apache server 2.2
PHP 5.2.11

thank you once again for the time you have spent for this issue.
